javadoc: Container class to hold a name, value, and class of the value.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: value
params.comment: value of the option. Value can't be null with this constructor.

methods.name: <init>
<init>
<init>
<init>
getCustomEditorComponent
methods.comment:
Override if you want to provide a custom widget for selecting your
 options. 
 
 Important! If you override this you MUST also override the #copy()
 method so it returns a new instance of your custom editor.

methods.javadoc: Return the class of the value for this Option.
methods.name: getValueClass
methods.comment: Return the class of the value for this Option.

methods.javadoc:
Return the group name for this option; may be null if group was
 not specified.
methods.name: getGroup
methods.comment:
Return the group name for this option; may be null if group was
 not specified.

methods.javadoc: Return the name of this Option.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Return the name of this Option.

methods.javadoc: Return the value of this Option.
methods.name: getValue
methods.comment: Return the value of this Option.

methods.javadoc:
Set the value for this option.
@param object value of this option
methods.name: setValue
methods.comment: Set the value for this option.

methods.name: parseAndSetValueByType
methods.comment:
Set the value for this option by parsing the given string and converting it to the option's
 type.  Fails if this option doesn't have a type associated with it, or if an unsupported
 type is needed to be parsed.

params.name: str
params.comment: The value to set, in string form.

params.name: addressFactory
params.comment:
An address factory to use for when the option trying to be set is an Address.
 If null, an exception will be thrown for Address type options.

return.comment: True if the value was successfully parsed and set; otherwise, false.

methods.javadoc:
Return the command line argument for this Option.
@return The command line argument for this Option.  Could be null.
methods.name: getArg
methods.comment: Return the command line argument for this Option.

return.comment: The command line argument for this Option.  Could be null.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a copy of this Option object.
@return a copy of this Option object.
methods.name: copy
methods.comment: Creates a copy of this Option object.

return.comment: a copy of this Option object.

name: Option
comment: Container class to hold a name, value, and class of the value.
